p: There were significant negative correlations between the body size (as measured by body mass in kilograms) of the study mammals and their average survival rates over 4 time periods (905 BC to AD 2000, AD 1000 to 2000, AD 1500 to 2000, and AD 1911 to 2000) ( Fig. 2), indicating that large-sized mammals (e.g., elephant, rhino, and panda) had larger population declines as measured by the proportion of survived grids than small-sized ones.
